mdRecord.dcterms:title: Le tombeau de Marguerite de Valois, royne de Nauarre / Faict premierement en disticques Latins par les trois sœeurs princesses en Angleterre. ; Depuis traduictz en Grec, Italié & François par plusieurs des excellentz poetes de la Frāce. ; Auecques plusieurs odes, hymnes, cantiques, epitaphes, sur le mesme subiect
mdRecord.dcterms:contributor: Douglas H. Gordon Collection of French Books (University of Virginia)
Herberay, Nicolas de sieur des Essars, active 16th century
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: De l'imprimerie de Michel Fezandat, & Robert Granion, au mont S. Hilaire à l'enseigne des Grans Ions, & au Palais en la boutique de Vincent Sartenas
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The three sisters were Anne, Margaret and Jane Seymour, the daughters of Edward Seymour, Duke of Somerset.

"Disticques Latins" originally published with title: Annae, Margaritae, Ianae, sororum virginum, heroidum anglarum, in mortem divae Margaritae Valesiae Navarrorum Reginæ, hecatodistichon. -- Paris, 1550.

Edited by Nicolas Denisot; address to the 3 sisters by Nicolas de Herberay; translations by Jean Dorat, Joachim Du Bellay, Antoine de Baïf, Nicolas Denisot, and others. Includes 4 odes by Pierre Ronsard and a collection of poems in Latin and French by other authors.

SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Binder: Lortic. Unidentified armorial bookplate, 2 crests side-by-side. Pencilled note, "Baron de Ruble, Vente 5/28/99, no. 165." Gordon Collection. Bookplate of Douglas Gordon. Gordon list, 146.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Marguerite, Queen, consort of Henry II, King of Navarre, 1492-1549
